publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3563 John Wilson: Strathclyde Police Prolific Offender Programme—That the Parliament congratulates Strathclyde Police on the success of the Prolific Offender Programme, aimed specifically at drug and alcohol offenders, which has resulted in a 30% reduction in offending rates, particularly regarding shop lifting, housebreaking and prostitution; welcomes the inclusion of counselling, education and housing opportunities as part of the rehabilitation process under this pioneering initiative aimed at improving community safety, and notes that since 2007 over 194 people have been involved in the initiative while 95 people remain engaged in the programme.

S3M-3563 John Wilson: Strathclyde Police Prolific Offender Programme—That the Parliament congratulates Strathclyde Police on the success of the Prolific Offender Programme, aimed specifically at drug and alcohol offenders, which has resulted in a 30% reduction in offending rates, particularly regarding shop lifting, housebreaking and prostitution; welcomes the inclusion of counselling, education and housing opportunities as part of the rehabilitation process under this pioneering initiative aimed at improving community safety, and notes that since 2007 over 194 people have been involved in the initiative while 95 people remain engaged in the programme. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*, Rob Gibson*, Brian Adam*, Patrick Harvie*, Bob Doris*, Angela Constance*, Sandra White*, Elaine Smith*, Bill Wilson*, Robin Harper*

S3M-3563*#* John Wilson: Strathclyde Police Prolific Offender Programme—That the Parliament congratulates Strathclyde Police on the success of the Prolific Offender Programme, aimed specifically at drug and alcohol offenders, which has resulted in a 30% reduction in offending rates, particularly regarding shop lifting, housebreaking and prostitution; welcomes the inclusion of counselling, education and housing opportunities as part of the rehabilitation process under this pioneering initiative aimed at improving community safety, and notes that since 2007 over 194 people have been involved in the initiative while 95 people remain engaged in the programme. Supported by: Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-3563# Strathclyde Police Prolific Offender Programme (lodged on 26 February 2009) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-3563# Strathclyde Police Prolific Offender Programme (lodged on 26 February 2009) Hugh Henry*
S3M-3563# Strathclyde Police Prolific Offender Programme (lodged on 26 February 2009) Christina McKelvie*
S3M-3563# Strathclyde Police Prolific Offender Programme (lodged on 26 February 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3563# Strathclyde Police Prolific Offender Programme (lodged on 26 February 2009) Anne McLaughlin*
